title: Stop bringing healthy ADCs up, start knocking OP ones down
body:
It upsets me seeing this Jinx buff, its fairly significant and Jinx is literally fine. Jinx, Cait, Draven, Ashe etc are **NOT** bad, they are **outshined** by better adcs thus making them unviable. 

Everyone complains about ADC powercreep, LISTEN..

Stop power-creeping them more.

Particularly with ADCs, a low win rate is not always because they're weak. Every game has a ADC in, so all of the ADCs win-rates are comparative to other ADCs.  A low win rate does not necessitate buffs. 

A year of people complaining about the class as a whole and still no meaningful steps forward. It's not like it's circle-jerking either, pros/high elo streamers alike hate this shit. Listen to us **PLEASE**

If this jinx buff goes live it'll literally just be getting rid of one problem and creating another, potentially bigger problem. Jinx being significantly buffed in the same patch a major competitor is nerfed just does not make sense at all.

I wouldn't go about making claims like "everyone complains about X", because those claims tend to be interpreted literally and torn apart to the detriment of the larger message at hand. With that said, I agree with the larger point, and I think that nerfing exceptionally powerful marksmen would increase the win rates of those who are underperforming: marksmen are perhaps the most isolated class in the game when it comes to balance, because they occupy a position on the map reserved for them, which they occupy on both teams in every game, and which pits one against the other. Effectively, the vast majority of marksmen are only balanced relative to other marksmen in terms of direct win and play rates, so their aggregated balancing tends to be zero-sum within the class, something that cannot be said for any other. With exclusively bot lane marksmen like Jinx, her win rate is low only because the win rate of other marksmen is so high, and buffing her to their level will only lead to more champions suffering indirectly as a result.

Because of this, I think it should be important to not only check the win rates of marksmen (which, in this particular scenario, tend to give off the wrong information), but also check the win rates of marksmen against teams _with no marksmen at all_. Though data for that currently seems to be lacking due to the extreme rarity of those scenarios (which should itself be worrying), I can safely bet that their win rates in those situations would skyrocket. While there are a lot of factors that could explain that (marksmen are the best objective-takers, and objectives are essential in League), the net result would nonetheless be that marksmen possess power that makes them essential to every team, which is detrimental to diversity. Imposing meaningful tradeoffs to that power, sharing that power with other classes, or otherwise establishing a situation where marksmen are no longer mandatory (but still viable and picked frequently) is a step Riot needs to take if they want to engineer a more diverse and balanceable environment.
